query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Nel mezzo del cammin di nostra vita 2 mi ritrovai per una selva oscura, 3 ché la diritta via era smarrita.
query.result:
**English:**
1 In the middle of the journey of our life 2 I found myself in a dark wood, 3 because the straight way was lost.
**Cornish:**
1 Y'n kres an fordh a'gan byw 2 y'm kavos yn koedh tywyll, 3 ragan fordh onan oedh kollet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Ahi quanto a dir qual era è cosa dura 5 esta selva selvaggia e aspra e forte 6 che nel pensier rinova la paura!
7 Tant’ è amara che poco è più morte; 8 ma per trattar del ben ch’i’ vi trovai, 9 dirò de l’altre cose ch’i’ v’ho scorte.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Ah! how hard it is to tell what it was like, 5 this wild, savage and harsh forest 6 that renews fear in my thoughts!
7 It is so bitter that it is little more than death; 8 but to speak of the good that I found there, 9 I will tell of the other things that I saw there.
**Cornish:**
4 Ah! kemmys yw dywedh pyth yw 5 an wals magh, gwyls ha kalet 6 hag a wra'n poyntas nowyth da'n ofn!
7 Kemmys yw fethna yw marow bys vyth; 8 mes rag treylya an da ga vys vy, 9 yth wra vy dywedha'n tra owerel awel ys vy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Io non so ben ridir com’ i’ v’intrai, 11 tant’ era pien di sonno a quel punto 12 che la verace via abbandonai.
query.result:
**English:**
10 I do not know well how I entered it, 11 so full of sleep was I at that point 12 that I abandoned the true way.
**Cornish:**
10 Ny wodhav vy ben pyth y'm kerdhas y'nno, 11 kemmys oen vy leun a'n poynt na, 12 ha'm gollys an fordh wir a-barth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Ma poi ch’i’ fui al piè d’un colle giunto, 14 là dove terminava quella valle 15 che m’avea di paura il cor compunto,
16 guardai in alto e vidi le sue spalle 17 vestite già de’ raggi del pianeta 18 che mena dritto altrui per ogne calle.
query.result:
**English:**
13 But after I had reached the foot of a hill, 14 where that valley ended 15 which had filled my heart with fear,
16 I looked up and saw its shoulders 17 already clothed with the rays of the planet 18 that leads people straight on every path.
**Cornish:**
13 Mes wosa vy dhegys a-barth, 14 le may hy finya an glyn na, 15 a wra'm golon leun a-barth,
16 y'm selwas dhe-ves ha'm gwelas y'n skennow 17 wiskys gans sklerow an planet 18 a ledyas den straght bys vyth fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Allor fu la paura un poco queta, 20 che nel lago del cor m’era durata 21 la notte ch’i’ passai con tanta pieta.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Then the fear that had lasted in my heart 20 like a lake was somewhat quieted 21 during the night that I passed with such pity.
**Cornish:**
19 An poynt na, an ofn oedh le a-barth, 20 a wra'n bewnans yn-dann y'm kolon 21 an nos na drehedhas gans kemmys trues.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 E come quei che con lena affannata, 23 uscito fuor del pelago a la riva, 24 si volge a l’acqua perigliosa e guata,
25 così l’animo mio, ch’ancor fuggiva, 26 si volse a retro a rimirar lo passo 27 che non lasciò già mai persona viva.
query.result:
**English:**
22 And like someone who, with labored breath, 23 has emerged from the sea to the shore, 24 turns to look at the perilous water,
25 so my soul, which was still fleeing, 26 turned back to look at the pass 27 that no living person ever left.
**Cornish:**
22 Ha kepar den a-gledhans an aval, 23 wosa dos ha bos an mor dhe'n glann, 24 a wra'n tro' dhe'n dowr peryllus ha'n gwelas,
25 hemma dell yw enef, a wra'n bewnans ow tos, 26 a dro' dhe'n kes dhe welas an fordh 27 na wra'n neb bewnans ow parti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Poi ch’èi posato un poco il corpo lasso, 29 ripresi via per la piaggia diserta, 30 sì che ’l piè fermo sempre era ’l più basso.
query.result:
**English:**
28 After my weary body had rested a little, 29 I set off again on my way through the deserted plain, 30 so that my firm foot was always the lower one.
**Cornish:**
28 Wosa vy le a-barth y'm korf marow, 29 y'm kerdhas arta dhe'n fordh difeyth, 30 hemma dell oen vy'm tros ughella.

**English:**
31 And behold, almost at the beginning of the ascent, 32 a she-panther, light and very swift, 33 covered with a spotted pelt;
34 and it would not leave my sight, 35 indeed it hindered my path so much 36 that I was about to turn back many times.
**Cornish:**
31 Ha, weles vy, a-gledhans an ughella, 32 lonza golow ha byw ow tos, 33 ow tos golow skynnys.
34 Hi na wra'n ow parti a-rag vy, 35 mes ow lettya vy'm fordh kemmys, 36 bythkweth vy ow tos dhe'n kes meur ras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Temp’ era dal principio del mattino, 38 e ’l sol montava ’n sù con quelle stelle 39 ch’eran con lui quando l’amor divino
40 mosse di prima quelle cose belle; 41 sì ch’a bene sperar m’era cagione 42 di quella fiera a la gaetta pelle
43 l’ora del tempo e la dolce stagione; 44 ma non sì che paura non mi desse 45 la vista che m’apparve d’un leone.
query.result:
**English:**
37 It was the time of early morning, 38 and the sun was rising with those stars 39 that were with it when divine love
40 first moved those beautiful things; 41 so that the time of day and the sweet season 42 were a reason for me to have good hope 43 concerning that wild beast with the spotted skin;
44 but not so much that the sight of a lion 45 that appeared to me did not cause me fear.
**Cornish:**
37 An eur oedh a-gledhans an myttyn, 38 ha'n howl oedh ow tos dhe-ves gans an steren 39 a oedh gans pan wosa kar an garow dywin
40 ow tos movia an kynsa kensa; 41 hemma dell oedh an eur hag an seson dowr 42 ow tos owth vy dhe spyrra da 43 a-dro dhe'n best magh a'n skynnys golow;
44 mes na wra'n kemmys na wra'n ofn vy 45 wosa vy gwelas lew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Questi parea che contra me venisse 47 con la test’ alta e con rabbiosa fame, 48 sì che parea che l’aere ne tremesse.
query.result:
**English:**
46 It seemed to be coming towards me 47 with its head held high and raging hunger, 48 so that it seemed that the air trembled.
**Cornish:**
46 Hi a wra'n ow tos ow tos dhe'm gweles 47 gans y'n ben uhel ha gans aval kemmys, 48 hemma dell oedh an ayr ow tos ow kryjya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Ed una lupa, che di tutte brame 50 sembiava carca ne la sua magrezza, 51 e molte genti fé già viver grame,
52 questa mi porse tanto di gravezza 53 con la paura ch’uscia di sua vista, 54 ch’io perdei la speranza de l’altezza.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And a she-wolf, who seemed 50 laden with all cravings in her leanness, 51 and had already made many people live in misery,
52 this one caused me such heaviness 53 with the fear that came from her appearance, 54 that I lost hope of reaching the heights.
**Cornish:**
49 Ha onen voel, hag a-ugh oll an gwensow 50 a semla gorrys yn y mogerrans, 51 ha lies a wrug lies meur a dus,
52 henna a wrug dhym an keth poos 53 gans an ofn a dheuth dhyworth y golwg, 54 bys vy dhegolli an spyrans a'n ughelder.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Mentre ch’i’ rovinava in basso loco, 62 dinanzi a li occhi mi si fu offerto 63 chi per lungo silenzio parea fioco.
query.result:
**English:**
61 While I was falling down to a low place, 62 before my eyes there appeared 63 someone who seemed hoarse from long silence.
**Cornish:**
61 Pan oen vy dhegredhes dhe'n le may isel, 62 ragves dhe'm y'm golwg a dheuth dhe weles 63 unn den a semla goar dhyworth hirwos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Quando vidi costui nel gran diserto, 65 «Miserere di me», gridai a lui, 66 «qual che tu sii, od ombra od omo certo!».
query.result:
**English:**
64 When I saw him in the great desert, 65 “Have mercy on me,” I cried to him, 66 “whoever you are, a shade or a real man!”
**Cornish:**
64 Pan welyn henna yn an rosva meur, 65 “Bew m’aga,” vy gryssys dhe, 66 “pesya wheth, skwydh po unn den gwir!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Rispuosemi: «Non omo, omo già fui, 68 e li parenti miei furon lombardi, 69 mantoani per patrïa ambedui.
query.result:
**English:**
67 He answered me: “Not a man, a man I once was, 68 and my parents were Lombards, 69 both of them from Mantua by birth.
**Cornish:**
67 Ev a leveris dhym: “Nyns yw den vy, den oen vy, 68 ha’m gerens oedh Lombardyon, 69 Mantoanyon dre worhemmow.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Nacqui sub Iulio, ancor che fosse tardi, 71 e vissi a Roma sotto ’l buono Augusto 72 nel tempo de li dèi falsi e bugiardi.
query.result:
**English:**
70 I was born under Julius, though late, 71 and I lived in Rome under the good Augustus 72 in the time of the false and lying gods.
**Cornish:**
70 Vy genys veu yn-dann Yuli, byttegyns oedh diwedh, 71 ha vy bewnas yn Rom danvonn an brav Awgust 72 yn termyn an dewow gelwys ha fowt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Poeta fui, e cantai di quel giusto 74 figliuol d’Anchise che venne di Troia, 75 poi che ’l superbo Ilïón fu combusto.
query.result:
**English:**
73 I was a poet, and I sang of that just 74 son of Anchises who came from Troy, 75 after proud Ilium was burned.
**Cornish:**
73 Bardh oen vy, ha kanas vy a-dro dhe’n gwella 74 mab Ankhises a dheuth dhyworth Troia, 75 wosa Ilïon an balla oedh loskys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Ma tu perché ritorni a tanta noia? 77 perché non sali il dilettoso monte 78 ch’è principio e cagion di tutta gioia?».
query.result:
**English:**
76 But why do you return to such distress? 77 Why do you not climb the delightful mountain 78 which is the beginning and cause of all joy?
**Cornish:**
76 Mes whyethy’th whyth dhe’n keth poos magh? 77 Whyethy’th nagh yskynn an menydh hygar 78 hag yw penn ha kaws a-ugh oll an lowena?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 «Or se’ tu quel Virgilio e quella fonte 80 che spandi di parlar sì largo fiume?», 81 rispuos’ io lui con vergognosa fronte.
query.result:
**English:**
79 “Are you then that Virgil, that fountain 80 that pours forth such a broad river of speech?” 81 I answered him with a shamefaced brow.
**Cornish:**
79 “A wheth yw an Virgili henna ha henna fenten 80 a wra spredh avon kows gans keth lavarow?” 81 Vy leveris dhe gans talvos gwarthus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 «O de li altri poeti onore e lume, 83 vagliami ’l lungo studio e ’l grande amore 84 che m’ha fatto cercar lo tuo volume.
query.result:
**English:**
82 “O honor and light of the other poets, 83 let my long study and the great love 84 that made me search for your book avail me.
**Cornish:**
82 “O anner ha golow an bardhow erel, 83 gwra dhym an studhy hir ha’n garow meur 84 a wrug dhym hwilas orth aga lyver.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Tu se’ lo mio maestro e ’l mio autore, 86 tu se’ solo colui da cu’ io tolsi 87 lo bello stilo che m’ha fatto onore.
query.result:
**English:**
85 You are my master and my author, 86 you alone are the one from whom I took 87 the beautiful style that has brought me honor.
**Cornish:**
85 Ty yw ow mester ha'm awtour, 86 ty a-unan yw an neb a-dhymmys vy 87 an styl a-vri yw owth usya enor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Vedi la bestia per cu’ io mi volsi; 89 aiutami da lei, famoso saggio, 90 ch’ella mi fa tremar le vene e i polsi».
query.result:
**English:**
88 See the beast for which I turned back; 89 help me from her, famous sage, 90 for she makes my veins and pulses tremble."
**Cornish:**
88 Gweles an best a-dhymmys vyth owth ethymbas; 89 gwra vyth owth owth an best-na, eneth coeth, 90 rag yma hi ow gwythenn ha'm polsow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Molti son li animali a cui s’ammoglia, 101 e più saranno ancora, infin che ’l veltro 102 verrà, che la farà morir con doglia.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Many are the animals with which she mates, 101 and there will be more still, until the greyhound 102 comes, who will make her die in pain.
**Cornish:**
100 Lies yw an eneval a-gemmyn hi, 101 ha moy a vydh, bys veu an veltro 102 a dheuth, neb a wra yma hi mernans gans dowr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Questi non ciberà terra né peltro, 104 ma sapïenza, amore e virtute, 105 e sua nazion sarà tra feltro e feltro.
query.result:
**English:**
103 He will not feed on earth or metal, 104 but on wisdom, love, and virtue, 105 and his birthplace will be between felt and felt.
**Cornish:**
103 Nyns yw ev a wra boesow tir na peltro, 104 mes jynn, karanteth ha vertus, 105 ha y wlas a vydh ynter feltro ha feltro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Di quella umile Italia fia salute 107 per cui morì la vergine Cammilla, 108 Eurialo e Turno e Niso di ferute.
query.result:
**English:**
106 From that humble Italy will come salvation 107 for which the virgin Camilla died, 108 Euryalus and Turnus and Nisus from wounds.
**Cornish:**
106 A-dhyworth an Itali humbla-na 107 yth fydh an salvacyon 108 rag an verjyn Cammilla, Eurialo ha Turno ha Niso a verwes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Questi la caccerà per ogne villa, 110 fin che l’avrà rimessa ne lo ’nferno, 111 là onde ’nvidia prima dipartilla.
query.result:
**English:**
109 He will hunt her through every town, 110 until he has sent her back to Hell, 111 from where envy first unleashed her.
**Cornish:**
109 Ev a wra yma hi cassa dre bub villa, 110 bys veu ev yma hi dassendys dhe'n enefren, 111 le mayth owth an envy owth yma hi dassendys kyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 In tutte parti impera e quivi regge; 128 quivi è la sua città e l’alto seggio: 129 oh felice colui cu’ ivi elegge!».
query.result:
**English:**
127 In all parts he rules and there he reigns; 128 there is his city and his high throne: 129 oh happy is he whom he chooses there!
**Cornish:**
127 Y'n bub rann ev a-reign ha ena ev a-lewyrgh; 128 ena yw y cita ha'y seth uhella: 129 oh eus heppy an neb a-eth ev ow ethol ena!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 E io a lui: «Poeta, io ti richeggio 131 per quello Dio che tu non conoscesti, 132 acciò ch’io fugga questo male e peggio,
133 che tu mi meni là dov’ or dicesti, 134 sì ch’io veggia la porta di san Pietro 135 e color cui tu fai cotanto mesti».
query.result:
**English:**
130 And I to him: "Poet, I beg you 131 by that God whom you did not know, 132 so that I may escape this evil and worse,
133 that you lead me where you just said, 134 so that I may see the gate of Saint Peter 135 and those whom you make so sorrowful."
**Cornish:**
130 Ha my a-dho: "Bardh, vy a-wynn 131 rag an Duw na wodhysso, 132 rag an golen hynn dre vyn hag gwaeth,
133 rag an gorra vy vy dhe-ves, 134 rag an gweles porth Sen Peder 135 ha'n dus a wra vy dhe-ves trist."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Allor si mosse, e io li tenni dietro.
query.result:
**English:**
136 Then he moved, and I followed him.
**Cornish:**
136 Pan wrug ev, ha my a-dhallathas.
